commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Add periodic job to mirror repos

Default mirror_repos() task to run every 5 minutes but is configurable
via MIRROR_INTERVAL in seconds.

Rework create_handler() to create repos without requiring
repositories.yaml

Make debug mode configurable via config.py configuration, default to
disabled but enable it in example configuration as that is what devs use
for testing.

Change-Id: Ia22b57489bb2b30f086c7b741c91d2d9be017642
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Add missing commit details

Fixes author and committer data and splits them appropriately. Author is
the change owner and creater while committer is the change merger.
Typically the committer is the person who approved a patch. Also return
both the author&committer email, date, and tz data.

Change date to reflect seconds since epoch. Most consumer hardware are
only accurate to the second unless using a realtime system. This is why
git stores seconds since epoch so just return what Git returns rather
than doing additional math that provides no more benefit.

Also provide commit message data in the object too. In the future we'll
want to parse the message for "Also-By" and "Co-Authored-By" fields to
pull in additional authors for patches that have multiple people working
on them.

Change-Id: I933fd9da6e19d5a64ccd5567d495b8d22603d77d
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Cache data on demand

There are situations where we cannot predict what to cache due to it
requiring user input such as commits_since_ref api. This patch adds a
function that allows us to cache data when the api is called and checks
the cache_age before determining if we should provide the user with the
cache version or we need to update the cache.

Two new functions are introduced via this patch:

get_cache(): This function tries to query the database for our cached
    document if possible. Otherwise it will query the API for fresh data
    and calls set_cache() in order to set cached data.

set_cache(): This function is a simple function that is used to store a
    document into cache.

Also updates 3 Git APIs with the ability to cache.

    git.branches
    git.commits
    git.commits_since_ref

Change-Id: I2f62424ab9e255b50434a315eab7695ff4741803
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

Signed-off-by: A H <an.ho@huawei.com>

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Add API to return commits since ref

/git/commits_since_ref/

    branch: branch to get commit log from
    ref: reference point to search until. ref can be any commit hash as
         well as branches and tags.

Searches Git for a common_parent between *branch* and *ref* and returns
the commit log of all the commits until the common parent excluding the
common_parent commit itself.

Also implement a utils function check_parameters(mapping) for finding
missing required parameters for the API.

Example:

    mapping = {
        'project': request.args.get('project', None),
        'branch': request.args.get('branch', 'master'),
    }

In this example 'project' is a required parameter so the get() method
defaults to None indicating that it is a required parameter. On the other
hand 'branch' is an optional parameter so we set a default value master in
the event that branch is not explicitly passed.

Change-Id: I4168e023b77bfddbb6f72057e849925ba2dffa17
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

Simplify git.commits API failure detection

and return error.

Change-Id: I7bdbbd3cb864f0fe2b1a9810fadc540485bb4622
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Refactor initialization scripts

Summary:
- Fixes issue preventing auto reloader from reloading code in dev
- Refactor multiprocessing into a task scheduler
- Use APScheduler for task scheduling
- Refactor init scripts to support gunicorn and cli startup modes
- Fix Rest API docs linking

The Flask reloader problem was caused by the multiprocessing module
holding it's own system process which Flask's reloader couldn't reload
so was not able to automatically reload when it detected Spectrometer
code change.

Instead implement APScheduler as a background task manager to run the
database collector. This will allow us to add additional interval tasks
in the future as we need them. If we ever need a more complex scheduler
we could investigate Celery in the future.

Also refactor init scripts so that they support starting up in dev mode
via cli scripts as well as production mode using a WSGI system such as
gunicorn.

Change-Id: Ic98dc71f9db573b26916949e8ca277bac31746cd
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Refactor Git API into Flask Blueprint

This patch converts the Git API into a Flask Blueprint. Blueprints are
handy for making modular Flask applications and is the recommended way
to create the kinds of things we want to do with the APIs.

Additional tweaks:
- Rename module_name to projects
- Rename branch_name to branch
- Fix typo commiter -> committer

See:
http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/blueprints/

Change-Id: I483236529e41ee8ac06b3cfbd272406dd6c5937f
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

Refactor Gerrit API into a Flask Blueprint

different api type we want to use should go into the api folder and

Also create a handlers folder to manage the various handlers.

See:
http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/blueprints/

Introduce MongoDB usage for repositories info.

Commits info from all repositories is collected in a parrallel process
and stored in "spectrometer" database in "commits" collection.

REST API for querying commits accepts a "db" argument. If passed and
evaluated to True, database will be queried resulting in a
significantly faster response.

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Add setup.py configuration for program run scripts

This allowes Python to install spectrometer-dashboard to a location that
the end user can run after "pip install spectrometer" by simply typing
"spectrometer-dashboard" on their local system.

In a development environment devs would use the command "python
spectrometer" to run the app.

Change-Id: Ia3595dbf0dff12fabdbfb49915dd1756900e6bc1
Signed-off-by: Thanh Ha <thanh.ha@linuxfoundation.org>

commits.message:
Use a variable to load config

user in a production environment.

commits.author: Thanh Ha
commits.message:
Fix PEP8 errors in code

Current spectrometer code does not pass pep8 scanners. We should update
the code to fix all the existing pep8 issues and then activate a Gerrit
Trigger job to automatically validate pep8 on future code reviews.
